DataElement.preferredName: Breast Neoplasm Other Surgical Procedure Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe a surgical procedure performed for a malignant neoplasm of the breast that is different from previously identified options.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic Other Surgical Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma.  It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue.  Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males. -- 2003:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Breast Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma.  It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue.  Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males. -- 2003:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm of the breast parenchyma. It can originate from the ducts, lobules or the breast adipose tissue. Breast neoplasms are much more common in females than males.
A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
